Package com.amonson.node_monitoring

Class Message

java.lang.Object
com.amonson.node_monitoring.Message
public class Message extends Object
Message class for messages handled by the NodeMonitoringZeroMQ class.

  • Constructor Details

    • Message

      public Message(String topic, String sender, Iterable<String> targets, String... messageParts)
      Create a Message instance with topic, sender, target(s) and optional payload parts.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic used to send the message. If the topic is not registered by peers the message will be lost.
      sender - This is your hostname, network resolvable. Use of non-resolvable names here will result in lost messages.
      targets - The list of targets to send the message. The collection cannot be null or empty.
      messageParts - The list of message parts of the payload. It is acceptable to not have any payload parts.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if topic and sender are null or empty, also if targets is null or length 0.

    • Message

      public Message(String topic, String sender, String targets, String... messageParts)
      Create a Message instance with topic, sender, target(s) and optional payload parts.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic used to send the message. If the topic is not registered by peers the message will be lost.
      sender - This is your hostname, network resolvable. Use of non-resolvable names here will result in lost messages.
      targets - The list of targets to send the message. The string is a comma separated list with no spaces.
      messageParts - The list of message parts of the payload. It is acceptable to not have any payload parts.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if topic, sender or targets are null or empty.

    • Message

      public Message(String topic, String sender, String targets, Iterable<String> messageParts)
      Create a Message instance with topic, sender, target(s) and optional payload parts.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic used to send the message. If the topic is not registered by peers the message will be lost.
      sender - This is your hostname, network resolvable. Use of non-resolvable names here will result in lost messages.
      targets - The list of targets to send the message. The string is a comma separated list with no spaces.
      messageParts - The list of message parts of the payload. It is acceptable to use 0 parts in the collection.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if topic, sender or targets are null or empty.

    • Message

      public Message(String topic, String sender, Iterable<String> targets, Iterable<String> messageParts)
      Create a Message instance with topic, sender, target(s) and optional payload parts.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic used to send the message. If the topic is not registered by peers the message will be lost.
      sender - This is your hostname, network resolvable. Use of non-resolvable names here will result in lost messages.
      targets - The list of targets to send the message. The collection cannot be null or empty.
      messageParts - The list of message parts of the payload. It is acceptable to use 0 parts in the collection.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if topic and sender are null or empty, also if targets is null or length 0.

  • Method Details

    • targetsContains

      public boolean targetsContains(String node)
      Check if the hostname node passed is in the targets list of this instance.
      Parameters:
      node - The hostname to check for inclusion in the targets list.
      Returns:
      true indicates the passed node is present in the targets list, false otherwise.

    • getTargetsAsString

      public String getTargetsAsString()
      Get the targets list as a string.
      Returns:
      The comma separated list of targets in this instance.

    • forEachTargetDo

      public void forEachTargetDo(Message.FECallback action, Object arg)
      Loop over targets calling a callback.
      Parameters:
      action - The callback called for each target in this instance.
      arg - Any object you want to pass through into the callback.

    • getMessageParts

      public String[] getMessageParts()
      Get the message payload parts as a String[].
      Returns:
      The String[] of all payload message parts.

    • getMessagePartsIterable

      public Iterable<String> getMessagePartsIterable()
      Get the payload message parts as a string iterable.
      Returns:
      The iterable for the list of payload message parts.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Convert the entire message to a string for display. NOTE: do not use in tight loops as this is not efficient.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The string representation of the message.
